headline: Nine arrested in murder probe over far-right activist's death in Lyon
description: A parliamentary aide from the radical-left party La France Insoumise was among those arrested over the fatal beating of Quentin Deranque, a 23-year-old far-right activist.

headline: France and Algeria agree to resume security cooperation
In Kyiv, a fourth winter of war spares no one
Paul Magnette, political scientist: 'If Trump and his friends were truly convinced of their superiority, would they spend so much time trying to divide Europeans?'
description: Rather than bemoan their dependence on the United States, European Union member states should defend their federal and democratic system and strive for greater autonomy, argues the president of Belgium's French-speaking Socialist Party, in this opinion piece for Le Monde.

headline: Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
description: Although many have disappeared, 'caravaneige' campsites – those that welcome campers and caravans in the snow – are still enjoying good times at high altitudes, driven by a new generation of skiing campers and their unbeatable prices.

headline: In an open letter, dozens of film figures slam Berlin Film Festival 'silence' on Gaza
description: The statement, published on Tuesday, came after the Berlinale's jury president, German director Wim Wenders, answered a question on Gaza last week by saying: 'We cannot really enter the field of politics.' Signatories include Oscar-winning actors Javier Bardem and Tilda Swinton.

headline: 'Marty Supreme,' with Timothée Chalamet: An existential and frenetic table tennis journey
description: Director and screenwriter Josh Safdie, now working apart from his brother Benny, gives the 'Dune' star the standout role of his career as a brash table tennis player inspired by Marty Reisman.

headline: Iran and US agree on 'guiding principles' for a deal, say Iranian officials
Peru's Congress impeaches interim President Jose Jeri
Storms decimate thousands of puffins on France's Atlantic coast
'Unprecedented' flooding in France is expected to last all week
Jesse Jackson, pastor and civil rights icon, dies at 84
Russian and Belarusian athletes permitted to compete under national flags at 2026 Paralympics
At Navalny's grave, two years after his death in a Russian prison: 'We are not alone'
Chinese kung-fu robots steal the show in world's most-watched TV program
Macron kicks off three-day India visit with €30-billion fight jet deal on the table
ICC judge hit by US sanctions urges EU to step in
French prosecutors intervene in defense of TotalEnergies in climate trial
Diplomat Anne-Claire Legendre succeeds Jack Lang at Arab World Institute
The Epstein case: Thirty years of judicial negligence, at the expense of victims
description: The first complaints against the millionaire date back to 1996. Yet between his initial conviction in 2008 and his arrest in the summer of 2019, he was never troubled by the justice system.

headline: French music festivals to book for late winter and early spring
description: Electronic music, rock, chanson française, hip-hop... From Paris to Marseille, via Saint-Malo or Caen, the French festival scene offers an abundance of options sure to satisfy every musical taste.

headline: Agnès Delahaye, historian: 'The Minneapolis protests are part of the major historical social struggles in the US'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the historian said that Donald Trump's narrative of a white America radiating power is intended to erase the complexity of a multicultural past shaped by violence and struggles for emancipation.

headline: Rejecting political violence
Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei: The twilight of a tyrant
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
